Bill de h=D3ra asked:
> Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to under=
stand a project 
> whose junit code is organized as follows:
> 
>    src/
>=
        java/
>             a/b/c
>        test/
>             a/b/c

Yes, =
I've got something similar.  My organization is actually as follows

	proje=
ct/
		classes/
		source/
			com/...
		test/
			com/...

In the Resource Per=
spective, rightclick on the project in the Navigator tree
and select Proper=
ties.  Select "Java Build Path" on the left and the
"Source" tab on the rig=
ht.  Set the radio button for "Use source folders
contained in the project"=
 and either add or create your source and test
folders.

It works for me, b=
ut ask away if this doesn't work or doesn't make sense.

 - George
